text: as a kid growing up I loved Scientology
I applied it to my life I found it to
work and I really loved it and it helped
me in many ways
I saw it help others and I knew to me
that it was very important and I wanted
to be a Scientologist with or without my
parents I had made that decision I
joined the C organization when I was 16
and I couldn't think of anything else
that I would want to do the fraternity
was so amazing if you grow up in
Scientology you know about the C
organization you know that that's like
the highest level of dedication to
Scientology and mankind and that if you
join that you know it's a big commitment
the contract basically asks for your
dedication for a billion years and it's
sort of just the significance that you
are going to you know be with this group
from now until forever basically I never
thought I would leave never what
contributed to me deciding to leave was
that the organization that I was at at
the very end was awful there came a
point in time where I had to decide
between my husband or the Sea Org he had
witnessed David Miscavige is direct
subordinates acting in very you know
cruel ways I mean he'd witnessed
somebody getting slapped in the face ten
times he'd seen too much he'd been
through too much trauma to want to be a
part of it anymore and I said you know
I'm gonna go with my husband what we
don't agree with is is David Miscavige
and the way that he's running the Church
of Scientology in the way he's changed
things you know and the way it's not
being done standardly it's not being
done as Ellen Hubbard expected it to be
done and the things that are happening
there and the way these executives are
being treated and he's completely
dismantled what it should be I knew that
we weren't going to get out of there
very easily I just said well we need to
get pregnant the rules are that you're
not allowed to have children in the sea
organization if you do have children you
have to leave so then after I did tell
them that I was that I was pregnant and
that we wanted to leave it took another
two and a half months so the reason why
you'd want to go through that
cess of actually leaving on their terms
if you just get up and walk out the door
there's a policy that says if you if
it's called blowing if you blow you can
be declared a suppressive person and
once you're declared a suppressive
person Scientologists
the world over are the policy that they
have to apply is disconnection they
can't speak to you they can't talk to
you so your family won't talk to you
anymore
that's it you're you're gone you're in
bad standing with the church my parents
are both active members my brother and
sister both work for Scientologists so I
had many reasons to not want to get
disconnected my family stopped speaking
to me my brother my sister my mother my
father and all of the friends that I had
that were Scientologists disconnected
for me I was really really upset about
that I cried and cried and cried and
cried it was heartbreaking
I love Scientology I love the philosophy
I haven't left the faith at all and I
and I won't ever leave it it's too
important to me I don't want to be part
of organized Church of Scientology
anymore
